titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for David Eberhard papers, 1946-1983.
titlestmt.author: Justin Lee Tyler

repository.corpname: Detroit Public Library. Burton Historical Collection.

did.abstract: These papers of Rev. David Eberhard, a Detroit City Councilman for many years, contain correspondence, election campaign materials, reports and information on subjects from A-Z.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Born in Louisville, Kentucky on January 1, 1934, David Eberhard is a graduate of Concordia College, Fort Wayne, Indiana and Concordia Seminary, St. Louis, Missouri. He holds a Bachelor of Arts and a Bachelor of Divinity degree. He married Beverly Jacobs, and they had five children. After his 1959 graduation from the seminary, he was assigned in 1961 as pastor of Riverside Lutheran Church in Detroit, an urban congregation on the lower east side. Rev. Eberhard's work in the community earned him acclaim in national magazines, newspapers and on television. Riverside Lutheran Church was closed in 1976, and Rev. Eberhard was transferred to the Historic Trinity Lutheran Church on Gratiot Avenue. Rev. Eberhard was first elected to the Detroit City Council in 1969, and stepped down in 1993.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Series;Separated into three series: I: Subjects. II: Correspondence. III: Election Campaigns.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research use.

otherfindaid.head: Other finding aids note
otherfindaid.p: Finding aid and white index cards available in the Burton Historical Collection and on the World Wide Web.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

dsc.head: Container List
dsc.p: The following section contains a detailed listing of the materials in the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content note
scopecontent.p: Subject headings, A-Z, have been used in the order they were by Councilman Eberhard's office file. They include departments and agencies of the City of Detroit.

did.unittitle: Bell and Hudson Contract, 36"' District Court Reorganization, 1983
Elected and Employee Legal Representation Ordinance, 1983
Maintenance Central for Seniors, I98 I -1982

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content note
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the correspondence contains invitations received. Many include Rev. Eberhard's personal remarks concerning accepting or declining the invitations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content note
scopecontent.p: Election campaigns naturally make up a good deal of material in this collection. This section is arranged chronologically, with Fundraisers separated as a sub-series. Among the fundraisers was a German-inspired festival, known as "Gemutlichkeit". Meaning "good times and good fellowship", Rev. Eberhard `s fundraisers of this name were annual or semi-annual events that featured dinner, music, dance and libations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content note
scopecontent.p: The oldest items in the collection are contained in this series, dating back to 1946 and 1947 (Master Plans, Box 20). Most reports date from the 1950s to the 1980s. They arc arranged alphabetically by title or subject. Master plans, reports on population and social planning are listed in separate subseries.
